I am mystified by rabbit snakes, and yet it's one of my favorites of yours. I'd never assume it's an artist's place to explicate their work but do you have anything to share about the motivations or context of writing it? Thanks <3

yes, basically i was getting more and more frustrated year after year that the songwriting just wasn't happening, despite feeling very terribly overqualified for it. i had already envisioned a strategy of 'making the first part bad', but even that wasn't getting me anywhere. so i updated my strategy to: 'make the first part really insanely bad like you don't understand like please really go ahead and sabatoge the thing'

what is your selection process for songs?

first, generate some entirely new ones. then when i'm done doing that, then, go through the entire list of everything and find ones that i would be excited about doing, and put those in a 'finalists' list. like the play-offs, in sports. top 20 or 30. Then, i actually start working on the writing for some of those, without choosing yet. Then i set a hard deadline, sometime in the next 24 hours, to decide which will be the next one to be finished, recorded, vidified etc. It gets pretty painful toward the end, and sometimes there is a lot of feelings of remorse and dread the next day. but in the end i have to trust the system because it's the best system i have

i have been making music as a hobby since March last year, and I frequently find myself getting attached to the verse chorus verse chorus bridge chorus structure. i have tried really hard to do something different because i am getting really bored of it. whenever i do something different, i'm just not happy with the results. either that, or i get stuck in nowhere. any ideas on how to overcome this?

check all the songs you listen to. see if any of them do something besides that form. See if there are any songs you really really like, that don't follow that form. figure out what it does instead. figure out what you want to call that. Just check out all the songs you know and see what kind of roadmap they're using. Just take some time and enjoy some different road maps. eventually they will all come out in your writing

Because I feel like there's gotta be more to it. Can you shed light on this? What is a "bad" arrangement and what is a "good" arrangement?

in terms of sound clarity, basically you just want to get as much power out of as few sounds as you can. when it gets too cluttered, it turns to mud. But, when you have less, sometimes it may feel like you need more power. it's a paradox that sometimes feels like it takes a lifetime to overcome. but everyone gets better at this, the more they do it. The issue goes back further than arranging, ..... ultimately it goes back to the songwriting. if you write a song good enough, it's almost impossible to fuck it up later

what was the meaning behind the first verse of "i'm best friends with my own front door"?

basically i was starting on a new experiment: finish an entire music video in 2 weeks or die trying. i was sick of failure, i had been trying to do this and kept failing. the previous several videos all took 8 weeks or more. and i just was so desperate and felt like my life was passing me by, so i just snapped and demanded myself to succeed at 2 weeks. So i'm going through the (long) list of songs and song ideas to choose from, and, ...... it's just not working. i'm going through the list for hours, not finding one i want to do. So at some point, my brain just said "what would the song you Want to do now sound like?" and spontaneously the first line hit me, and i knew immediately that that would be the next song. So i already know it feels right, seems right, means very much to me, etc, but, when i think about it i can also explain why this is. It's like i'm developing a friendliness toward the idea of just... walking out the front door. Just being honest with my situation, ... etc. and picking this next song should be something as easy as just opening the front door, in a friendly manner. Now the second line, again this all came to me instinctually, but i'm just trying to think about it now and explain it.... the second line ('i just closed it but it's opening more') .... this gets deeper because there is the feeling that even if i've failed to notice how easy things could be, ... the door is actually opening on its own. We all know we have the tendency to sometimes overlook the friendly and obvious choices in life, so i think this line gives me a pretty strong feeling because it's like it's saying, even if you miss it, the opportunity will grow more to make you notice it. And the next 2 lines, ('then the cops came and they sent me to jail, but tomorrow i'm gonna open it again'), and again this is not supposed to necessarily work good without the music. so please take this only in the context of the way it sounds in the song. So these 2 lines seem to be basically doubling down on this optimism: the 3rd line is like "nope, youre gonna get punished for taking the easy route", then the 4th line shows determination to overcome this. Another bit of optimism is tucked in here also because most jails don't let you open the door. So you're just saying, tomorrow you're gonna get another chance to easily and friendily open a door that was previously assumed to be unopenable.

a fun fact about world-altering: it's actually possible to do certain things that seem so NON world altering, that it actually seems world-altering in its level of non-world-altering. (ref: q.php?date=202101082303)1.8.21 11:03 pm  In that case, how about you change the name of "Stupid Song" to "i wanna be stupid" so less people confuse it with "The Stupid Song"?

because, the way that song feels, (the one about holding on to what you've got, etc etc) it just feels like a song that should be called "The ____ Song". this is strange, because i think i had to actually call that one "Stupid Song", but that one definitely feels like it should be called "The Stupid Song". You would think the other one should then be called "Stupid Song", because in fact, that other one (hold my hand / touch my face, etc) seems like more of just "a stupid song". that is how i think of that one. But, because of the silly nature of that song, as part of the sillyness, it becomes very important to call that one "The Stupid Song", to bring it that sense of conviction in its stupidness. So the truth is that the best title for both songs is "The Stupid Song". which is a mildly unfortunate coincidence, for the sake of the catalog

what is the best way to learn new songs on the piano for someonewho can read sheet music but at a slow speed?

spend more quality time with the instrument, without reading. start learning to use it to express your feelings. then try to figure out some songs, also without reading.
